neighborhoods.name: Trastevere
neighborhoods.description: One of Rome’s most charming and lively neighborhoods, known for its narrow cobbled streets, medieval churches, and vibrant nightlife.

closestStations: Local bus stops near Piazza Trilussa

neighborhoods.name: Monti
neighborhoods.description: A trendy neighborhood blending ancient ruins with a modern bohemian vibe, known for its vintage shops and artisanal eateries.
thingsToDo: Visit art galleries and vintage markets

closestStations: Numerous bus stops in the area

neighborhoods.name: Centro Storico
neighborhoods.description: The historic heart of Rome, filled with ancient landmarks, elegant piazzas, and timeless monuments.

neighborhoods.name: Testaccio
neighborhoods.description: A neighborhood known for its authentic Roman culinary scene, vibrant food markets, and rich local traditions.

neighborhoods.name: Prati
neighborhoods.description: An upscale neighborhood near the Vatican, known for its elegant streets, chic boutiques, and refined dining.

neighborhoods.name: San Lorenzo
neighborhoods.description: A lively, youthful area popular for its alternative culture, street art, and dynamic nightlife.

neighborhoods.name: Esquilino
neighborhoods.description: A vibrant, multicultural district known for its bustling markets, historic sites, and diverse dining options.

neighborhoods.name: Pigneto
neighborhoods.description: An up-and-coming, artsy neighborhood celebrated for its creative vibe, street art, and trendy cafés.

closestStations: Accessible via local bus routes (e.g., Bus 114)

neighborhoods.name: EUR
neighborhoods.description: A modern district characterized by imposing Fascist-era architecture, business centers, and expansive parks.

neighborhoods.name: Appia Antica
neighborhoods.description: A historic area along the ancient Appian Way, rich in archaeological sites, catacombs, and lush countryside.
thingsToDo: Cycle or walk along ancient roads

closestStations: Accessible by bus from central Rome
Regional train services from Roma Termini
